timeline.bodyText:
Although I'm not an expert of this area, maybe, if you would like to check whether text of a token is the same as given one, should use org.netbeans.api.lexer.TokenUtilities.textEquals() instead of toString().equals (e.g. !TokenUtilities.textEquals(tl.currentToken().text(), "{")), then should add // NOI18N to strings.
Please reformat your changes. (the changes below, too)
timeline.author: junichi11

replies.bodyText: It doesn't seem to be reformatted yet. Please add // NOI18N for strings that are not expected translation.
replies.author: junichi11

timeline.bodyText: These new constants don't seem to be needed, right? The keywords should have attribute KEYWORD, I think, and that should be enough to make them highlighted as a keyword.
timeline.author: lahodaj

timeline.bodyText:
My suggestion here would be to:

read the Permitted subclasses
if non-null/non-empty, do simply firstIdentifierToken("permits"), and add the token to contextKeywords
run scan(, null)
(so that the classes inside the permits clause are highlighted).
timeline.author: lahodaj

timeline.bodyText: These new constants do not seem to be really used, right? I.e. the lexer will never produce a token with this kind?
timeline.author: lahodaj

timeline.bodyText: I think it is sensible to use the same settings as for wrapping extends/implements. We may consider tweaking the UI to also mention permits (this applies to both wrapExtendsImplementsKeyword and wrapExtendsImplementsList).
timeline.author: lahodaj
lahodaj

timeline.bodyText: What happens if "non" is not followed by "-sealed"?
timeline.author: lahodaj

timeline.bodyText: I see the token ids are useful here - but I would suggest to add a way to do without them. Enhancing API just to simplify one place a little bit will hurt long-term maintenance.
timeline.author: lahodaj
